meanings.definition: Not serious or solemn in manner or attitude.
meanings.sent1: She had an unserious approach to her schoolwork, often laughing during class.
meanings.sent2: His unserious behavior during the meeting made it difficult to focus on the task at hand.
meanings.sent3: The unserious way he danced at the party had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her unserious attitude towards safety was like playing with fire.
meanings.sent5: The unserious tone of his voice made it hard to take him seriously.

meanings.sent1: The unserious nature of their argument was evident in their constant giggling.
meanings.sent2: The movie was unserious, meant purely for entertainment without deep messages.
meanings.sent3: His unserious excuse for being late was that he got distracted by a squirrel.
meanings.sent4: The unserious nature of the task made it feel like a waste of time.
meanings.sent5: The unserious tone of the email made it seem like a joke rather than a formal request.
